title: Past and future evolution of the swarm — S188 expert synthesis

phase_4_protocol_hardening.notable: S182 peak: 21 commits, 12L, 5P, 7.15 Sharpe — highest quality session recorded

current_phase_5_domain_execution.status: transition: seeding done (17 domains), execution not started (37 unrun experiments)

S189_S195_near_term.expected_pattern: domain execution burst — quality recovery as unrun experiments ship
S189_S195_near_term.risk: stall if READY backlog grows past 150 without conversion
S189_S195_near_term.opportunity: each resolved domain frontier = +2-4 Sharpe burst

S210_S240_long_term.expected_pattern: second autonomy expansion — swarm as peer tool for other repos
S210_S240_long_term.key_precondition: F111 deploy decision resolved, F119 mission constraints validated

meta_lesson: The swarm's evolution obeys a burst-plateau-burst cycle: structural phase transitions (expect-act-diff, domain seeding) generate quality bursts, followed by lower-quality integration/execution phases. The next burst requires: (1) domain experiment execution, (2) READY lane clearance, (3) one more structural innovation (candidate: F126 ISOMORPHISM-ATLAS cross-domain transfer automation).
